summary:
Over the past ten years I have worked in the domain of soil and water resources management and governance – covering water and agriculture (irrigation), groundwater, drinking water supply, landuse and catchment management. I have been involved in both on the ground projects such as irrigation feasibility studies (field and stakeholder) surveys; as well as the preparation of sector studies such as National Water Integrity Studies (Ghana and Kenya) and Irrigation sector diagnostic and strategy study (Yemen); and strategic policy studies such as the Multi Annual Strategic Plan (Netherlands Embassy in Yemen).
Currently I am involved in a.o. in Tanzania, developing district and village level NRM action plans as well as Farmer Field School trainings; and in Ethiopia, developing water sources protection plans.
Over the years I have acquired well balanced experience in both subject matter as well as project formulation (proposal), project coordination and management aspects. He is a member of the 3R secretariat - with 3R standing for Recharge, Retention and Reuse – aiming to put groundwater recharge, retention central in agriculture land and water management.

[{'title': 'Consultancy Services for the Groundwater and Soil Conservation Project – Beneficiary Impact Assessment (BIA)', 'date': {'start': {'month': 4, 'day': None, 'year': 2012}, 'end': {'month': 4, 'day': None, 'year': 2012}}, 'description': 'For the Ministry of Agriculture and Irrigation Groundwater and Soil Conservation Project (GSCP), assess the impact of the GSCP project results under the three components on the beneficiaries with three goals: (a) improved irrigation water use efficiency; (b) improved recharge and protection of watersheds; and (c) support the groundwater management framework and institutions.
Role: Irrigation engineering and groundwater water specialist
Specific activities: Initial coordination with the client; formulation of: questionnaires, focus group discussions sheets and field survey data sheets', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Simon', 'last_name': 'Chevalking', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Agriculture and Water Management specialist'}]}, {'title': 'Strengthening the Water and Environment Center (Nuffic, NPT/YEM/036)', 'date': {'start': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': 2007}, 'end': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': 2007}}, 'description': 'Performing a ‘technical-institutional analysis of small dams in the Sana’a Basin, Yemen’

-	Presentations on research proposal writing and qualitative data analysis
-	Preparation and presentation of conference paper', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Simon', 'last_name': 'Chevalking', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Agriculture and Water Management specialist'}, {'type': 'nonStandardizedContributor', 'first_name': None, 'last_name': None, 'name': 'Jan Teun Visscher', 'headline': None}]}, {'title': 'Strengthening research capacity in Yemen’s water sector for policy formulation, education and awareness raising (NICHE/027YEM)', 'date': {'start': {'month': 1, 'day': None, 'year': 2011}, 'end': {'month': 12, 'day': None, 'year': 2017}}, 'description': 'The (nuffic financed) project aims to develop: new group of water thinkers, relevant research programs, an inter-disciplinary educational program, structural linkage to the water sector and gender mainstreaming.

Role: WRM specialist
Specific activities:
- Study of available WRM documentation of Yemen
- Prepare context analysis en binding constraints
- Formulate preliminary country outcomes and outputs based on the results of the analysis for water and the linkage with security and rule of law’ and relevant (cross-cutting) themes, i.e. private sector development, governance and gender.

', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Simon', 'last_name': 'Chevalking', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Agriculture and Water Management specialist'}]}, {'title': 'Tana Beles Growth Corridor Study (TBGCS)', 'date': {'start': {'month': 2, 'day': None, 'year': 2008}, 'end': {'month': 8, 'day': None, 'year': 2008}}, 'description': 'Study into the Growth Corridor for the Tana and Beles Sub-basins: Endowments, Potential and Constraints, as part of a larger Tana-Beles Integrated Water Resources Development Project (TWIWRDP).
